column4: I have installed Windows 2000 Pro on a 2nd partition and Windows insisted on de-activating my primary partition.  How do I go about getting grub back so that I can dual boot to the OS of my choice?
:D  thanks.  thats the info I was hoping you'd give me :)  I could spend all night trying to find that myself :O
i'm running the live cd to recover my grub boot loader after installing a 2nd OS.  following the howto.. how do I tell if I have a /boot/ listing in my fstab?
open the /etc/fstab file (on your drive, so maybe /mnt/hda3/etc/fstab or something) and look for a /boot entry
did you run grub-install?
my guess would be to try 'grub-install --root-directory=/boot /dev/hda', but i'm not sure if that only applies when you have a separate boot partition
hmm, no, scrap that. I think plain 'grub-install /dev/hda' should work,
you don't have /boot on a separate partition
ok, and what's in it?
or rather, is it empty or not?
XFS is a different filesystem -- if you don't know, you probably aren't using it ;)
are you irc'ing from that machine at the moment?
are you still here? plain 'grub-install /dev/hda' worked?
yes to both
if you know the partition which windows is on, you can probably hack something from the grub command-line
yes
it shouldn't
you can put your menu.lst on http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl for us to look at it you want
you can use 'sudo fdisk -l' to list all the partitions ubuntu can find
the ubuntu installer thought that windows was on your second hard-drive, according to the paste
that will be (hd0,2)
